The Warriors of the Rising Sun

There is glory in fighting, but one must both live and fight with honor for that glory to matter. Every Warrior of the Rising Sun knows this truth, and they are all prepared to fight those who are dishonorable, whether in a duel or on the battlefield.
This character possesses unmatched honor, and is said to be both a skilled warrior and a gifted strategist.

[Root.GetBestName],
I welcome you into the ranks of the Warriors of the Rising Sun and hope that you will prove your honor, your bravery, and your martial prowess. Keep your sword at your side at all times, respect and honor your superiors, and hone your skills, and you may go far.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
I will prove myself!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
While you doubtlessly have learned the basics of personal combat we have often found that new Warriors of the Rising Sun know less than they should know in that regard. To progress further in our ranks, you must find a mentor and prove yourself to them.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
While you have proven that you are a true warrior there are those in the ranks of the Warriors of the Rising Sun that have yet to do so. To give them the opportunity to prove themselves, you should mentor one of them.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
I have just received word that you have taken on a new student as requested. I trust that you will train them to the best of your ability and that you will teach them to act honorably.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
Of course I will!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
You are a skilled warrior, but so is [duel_target.GetBestName], and it would benefit all Warriors of the Rising Sun if the question as to which one of you are the better warrior is laid to rest. I suggest you challenge [duel_target.GetHerHim] to a duel.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
With the death of [From.GetBestName] it is no longer possible for me to complete my mission to duel [From.GetHerHim].
With the death of [From.GetBestName] it is no longer possible for me to complete my mission to win a War of Honor against [From.GetHerHim].

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
It is no secret that you and [duel_target.GetBestName] are bitter rivals. No matter who is in the right, honor dictates that you should challenge [duel_target.GetHerHim] to a duel to the death to settle the matter once and for all.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
A true warrior is a skilled commander, and there is no better way for you to prove that you are indeed a skilled commander than to win a War of Honor against [war_target.GetBestName].

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
It pleases me that you have defeated your foe in a War of Honor in accordance with the desires of the Warriors of the Rising Sun. It certainly proves that you are an honorable warrior, and that they very likely are not.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
It pleases me that you have defeated your hated rival in a War of Honor in accordance with the desires of the Warriors of the Rising Sun. Clearly, you are in the right and they are as dishonorable as you say.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
As if there was any doubt!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
It displeases me and all other Warriors of the Rising Sun that you have failed to defeat your foe in a War of Honor. Perhaps you are not as skilled a commander as we had been led to believe...

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
It displeases me and all other Warriors of the Rising Sun that you have failed to defeat your hated rival in a War of Honor. It would seem it is not their honor that is lacking...

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
I have brought dishonor on myself...

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
It is well known that you and [war_target.GetBestName] are rivals, and we have all heard that you consider them dishonorable. Prove that you are the honorable party by defeating [war_target.GetHerHim] in a War of Honor.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
While engaging in glorious battle on the battlefield certainly is honorable there are times when a warrior needs to look to the defense of their lands and people, and it would be a good idea for you to construct a castle to make this more manageable.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
I have just received word that you have finished the construction of a new castle as requested. Keep it well maintained and garrisoned with loyal soldiers, and it shall serve you well.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
Of course I will do that!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
It is disappointing that your current focus in life is somewhat less honorable than it should be. To remedy this problem, I suggest that you immediately switch to the War Focus.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

In accordance with the desires of the Warriors of the Rising Sun I have decided to dedicate myself to warfare for the time being by switching to the War Focus. Hopefully, this will result in some benefits other than just the respect of my peers, even if such respect certainly would not be undesirable.
I have a good feeling about this!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
You are a great warrior, possibly one of the best in the Warriors of the Rising Sun, but there are skilled warriors elsewhere in the world too. If you wish to prove yourself the very best, you must seek them out and defeat them.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
You will §Rnever§! be allowed to prove yourself the Very Best in the future

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
The way in which you are governing your lands is less suitable for a warrior than it could be. A more feudal system would be more appropriate, and you should consider making the appropriate changes.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
I have been informed that you now are governing your lands in a fashion befitting a true warrior. I trust you will find this to be beneficial in the future.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
I have a good feeling about this!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
I write to you to request that you become my mentor so that I may learn the ways of the Warriors of the Rising Sun and prove myself worthy so that I one day may ascend to a higher rank.

By my hand and seal,
[FromFrom.GetSocietyRank] [FromFrom.GetFirstName]
Of course!
Prove that you're good enough to be my student first!
I will do it, if you pay me...
I will do it... for a Favor!
I think not!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
It would be a pleasure to mentor you in the ways of the Warriors of the Rising Sun. I will begin preparing a lesson plan right away.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
Sounds good to me!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
I might be prepared to mentor you in the ways of the Warriors of the Rising Sun as you ask, but first you will have to show me that you have what it takes to be my student.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
Very well!
I have nothing to prove to you!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
I am a busy [From.GetManWoman] and am uncertain as to whether I would be able to find the time to mentor you. However, in exchange for a small sum of gold I believe I can find the time...

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
I suppose that's fine...
I don't think so!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
I can see why you would want me to mentor you in the ways of the Warriors of the Rising Sun, and I might be willing to do you that favor, but in that case I would ask a favor in return at a later date...

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
I think that's reasonable!
Not happening!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
You may have been allowed to join the ranks of the Warriors of the Rising Sun, but that is not sufficient reason for me to teach you. You will have to find someone else to teach you!

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
How rude!

[From.GetBestName] arrives without delay and eagerly shows me what [From.GetSheHe] is capable of as a warrior. In my experience, new members of the Warriors of the Rising Sun are generally somewhat lacking in skill regardless of their background, but [From.GetBestName] is possibly more skilled than I am.
I should suggest an even better mentor...
I can probably give [From.GetHerHim] a few tips...
I don't really think I want to teach [From.GetHerHim]...

[From.GetBestName] arrives without delay and eagerly shows me what [From.GetSheHe] is capable of as a warrior. While I notice some areas where [From.GetSheHe] might be lacking, [From.GetSheHe] does quite well, and it is clear that those that have given [From.GetBestName] lessons in the past left little for me to help [From.GetHerHim] improve on.
I will take [From.GetHerHim] on as a student!
I think this would be a waste of my time...

[From.GetBestName] arrives without delay and eagerly shows me what [From.GetSheHe] is capable of as a warrior. I notice some flaws, but also some strengths, and in my opinion [From.GetBestName] is about as skilled as the average new member of the Warriors of the Rising Sun tends to be. I could certainly help [From.GetHerHim] improve a bit.
[From.GetSheHeCap] would be a good student for me!
I would rather not teach [From.GetHerHim]...

[From.GetBestName] arrives without delay and eagerly shows me what [From.GetSheHe] is capable of as a warrior. I notice a few promising areas, but on the whole [From.GetSheHe] is a rather poor warrior, and it would likely take quite some work to help [From.GetHerHim] improve to the point where [From.GetSheHe] would perform adequately.
I'm willing to teach [From.GetHerHim]!
Teaching [From.GetHerHim] would be too much work...

[From.GetBestName] arrives without delay and eagerly shows me what [From.GetSheHe] is capable of as a warrior. To call [From.GetHerHis] performance "bad" would be charitable, to say the least, and it would doubtlessly be a major undertaking to make [From.GetHerHim] perform at even the lowest level I would deem acceptable for a Warrior of the Rising Sun.
I do like a challenge!
[From.GetSheHeCap] is not worth my time!

Despite giving [From.GetBestName] a fair opportunity to prove [From.GetHerselfHimself] worthy of being my student, which certainly was not out of order, [From.GetSheHe] does not agree to show me what [From.GetSheHe] is capable of. It seems [From.GetSheHe] was under the impression that all [From.GetSheHe] had to do was ask.
In that case, I must refuse!

It seems I have impressed [From.GetBestName] with my skills as [From.GetSheHe] informs me that [From.GetSheHe] is uncertain [From.GetSheHe] could teach me much. [From.GetSheHeCap] thinks that [better_mentor.GetBestName] might be a better mentor, and has offered to ask [better_mentor.GetHerHim] to become my mentor.
Sounds like a plan!
No, I want you to teach me!

Though I had expected [From.GetBestName] to accept my offer to try to get [better_mentor.GetBestName] to teach [From.GetHerHim], [From.GetBestName] surprises me by demanding that I mentor [From.GetHerHim] personally.
Very well!
I don't think that'd be good...

While my request seems to have taken [From.GetBestName] by surprise it evidently was a good idea to ask as [From.GetSheHe] has agreed to take me on despite [From.GetHerHis] initial reservations. Perhaps I will not learn as much as I might have been able to learn with another mentor, but I might also be able to prove myself more quickly...
I'm sure this will be good!

It seems I displeased [From.GetBestName] by insisting that [From.GetSheHe] should mentor me personally as [From.GetSheHe] has refused to entertain the notion and has rescinded [From.GetHerHis] previous offer to help me get another mentor. It seems I will have to approach someone else in person.
That was unexpected...

A messenger has arrived from [FromFrom.GetBestName], bearing a message telling me that [From.GetBestName] is an exceptionally gifted warrior and that it might be a good idea for me to mentor [From.GetHerHim] as [FromFrom.GetBestName] is uncertain whether [FromFrom.GetSheHe] could teach [From.GetBestName] much.
I would be happy to teach them!
I don't think so...

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
I hereby inform you that I have seen fit to accept you as my student, as requested by [FromFromFrom.GetBestName]. I hope that this will be a mutually beneficial arrangement.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
I look forward to learning from you!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
I hereby inform you that [FromFrom.GetBestName] has accepted me as [FromFrom.GetHerHis] student. I thank you for your help in arranging for it to happen.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
It was my pleasure!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
While [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] speaks highly of you I do not think it would be in my interest to mentor you as [FromFromFrom.GetSheHe] has requested.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
How rude!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
Despite your letter to [FromFrom.GetBestName] [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has refused to mentor me. I ask that you reconsider mentoring me, as I initially requested.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
I suppose I can do it...
I don't think that would be a good idea...

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
If [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] is unwilling to mentor you then I am prepared to do so. You certainly deserve an opportunity to prove yourself.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
I'm glad to hear that!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
I am surprised that [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] is unwilling to mentor you. However, though I understand your desire to get a mentor, I am not prepared to mentor you personally at this time.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
How rude!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
You have performed quite well, and I would definitely be willing to mentor you so that you may learn a few minor things that would be good for you to know.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
Good to hear!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
Your performance was not particularly impressive, but I am still willing to mentor you so that you may become truly worthy of being a Warrior of the Rising Sun.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
Well, that's fine!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
While your performance was decent enough I must say that I would rather not mentor you. You will have to find someone else to take you on.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
How rude!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
Your performance was not particularly impressive, and I therefore have no interest in mentoring you. I wish you better luck elsewhere.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
How rude!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
While I am surprised to learn that you would go as far as to demand money in exchange for mentoring me, I think it is an acceptable trade.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
Excellent!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
I think it is quite dishonorable of you to demand money in exchange for mentoring met. I will look elsewhere for a mentor.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
Good riddance!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
While I am surprised to learn that you would go as far as to demand a Favor in exchange for mentoring me I believe I can accept such an agreement.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
Excellent!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
I think it is quite dishonorable of you to demand a Favor in exchange for mentoring me, and I have no interest in any such arrangement. I will look elsewhere for a mentor.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
Good riddance!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
I am quite happy to know that we now share a mentor in [FromFrom.GetBestName] and look forward to having an opportunity to spend more time together.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
[FromFrom.GetBestName] has seen fit to mentor me as I seek to prove myself a worthy Warrior of the Rising Sun. I hope we can be friends, or that we at the very least will not become rivals.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

[Root.GetBestName],
[FromFrom.GetBestName] will be mentoring me from now on, and I look forward to proving that I am better than you in every way and that you are unfit to be a Warrior of the Rising Sun.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetBestName]
That's great!
I sure hope so...
You are a fool to oppose me!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
I am quite happy to hear that we now share a mentor in [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] and look forward to spending more time together.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
I have been told that [FromFrom.GetBestName] has seen fit to mentor you as well. I hope we will get along, and currently see no reason why that should not be possible.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

[Root.GetBestName],
I hear [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] will be mentoring you. I thank you for giving me the opportunity to prove that I am better than you in every way and that you are unfit to be a Warrior of the Rising Sun.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetBestName]
That's great!
I agree with that sentiment!
Oh, I look forward to proving the opposite!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
It has come to my attention that you do not yet have a mentor, and I humbly offer to mentor you so that you may advance further in the ranks of the Warriors of the Rising Sun.

By my hand and seal,
[FromFrom.GetSocietyRank] [FromFrom.GetFirstName]
That sounds like an excellent idea!
I think not!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
Your offer to mentor me is most definitely welcome, and I see no reason not to accept. I hope that this will be a mutually beneficial arrangement.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
Good to hear!

[Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],
Your offer to mentor me is very kind, but I think that another mentor would be better for me. I must refuse your offer.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
How rude!

I am expected to teach [From.GetBestName] how to use a variety of weapons more skillfully while mentoring [From.GetHerHim]. One of those weapons is the sword, which many would consider the most important weapon in the arsenal of any warrior. I should perhaps give [From.GetHerHim] another swordfighting lesson.
The sword is an elegant weapon...
I have better things to do...

[From.GetBestName], has seen fit to plan a swordfighting lesson for me, stating that it is something that [From.GetSheHe] thinks is a mandatory part of the training that every Warrior of the Rising Sun must undergo and further informing you that the sword is an elegant weapon.
... for a civilized age!
I think I have better things to do...

While other, less civilized, cultures might think that the bow is a weapon that a noble only should use when hunting, the Warriors of the Rising Sun have other opinions on the matter. It would probably not be amiss to spend some time working on [From.GetBestName]'s marksmanship.
I should give [From.GetHerHim] a lesson!
I have other plans...

[From.GetBestName], has announced that [From.GetSheHe] think it would be wise for the two of us to dedicate some time towards working on my skill with the bow, stating that it is good for every warrior to be a skilled archer even though there are those that are not Warriors of the Rising Sun that would disagree.
An archery lesson sounds good!
I can think of things I'd rather do...

Though the sword obviously is the weapon that a true Warrior of the Rising Sun should prefer in melee combat there are situations where a spear is more useful, and it would probably be amiss not to give [From.GetBestName] a lesson in how to handle that weapon in case [From.GetSheHe] should need it.
I can give a few tips...
Let's not bother with this...

Though [From.GetBestName] has told me that the sword is supposed to be my main weapon in melee combat [From.GetSheHe] has also suggested that there are situations where it might be a good idea to use something else, and now [From.GetSheHe] is suggesting that we should spend some time training with a spear since that can be a particularly useful alternative.
Sounds good to me!
I'd rather not...

Though it would not be amiss to spend some time giving [From.GetBestName] a lesson in how to fight on horseback, it would probably also be a good idea to spend some time just working on basic horsemanship as there are those that end up neglecting that to their detriment because they focus too much on mounted combat.
Saddle my horse!
Maybe later...

My mentor, [From.GetBestName], suprises me one day by announcing that [From.GetSheHe] thinks that we should spend the day riding and that the day's activities should not involve the use any weapons. Perhaps there is wisdom in that suggestion, as fighting is unlikely to be the only thing I will do from horseback.
Saddle my horse!
Maybe later...

I have heard that various less civilized cultures look down on a [Root.GetManWoman] using a bow from horseback on the battlefield instead of solely fighting in melee during mounted combat, but I know that the Warriors of the Rising Sun do not share that belief. The peasant children I agreed to give a quick lesson quickly picked up the basics that I initially had planned to teach them, and realizing that they might be ready to learn more I move on to more difficult things, which they also seem to get the hang of. Evidently they will be far more skilled warriors than I had thought possible.
They had a good teacher!

The peasant children seem to have played with wooden swords in the past, as they are not completely hopeless, but it still takes me quite some time to teach them what I would consider the essential basics that a warrior should know. They have improved a bit by the time I need to leave, but they are not particularly skilled.
I am not surprised

I had not expected the peasant children I agreed to teach to be particularly good, but I would at least have expected them to understand how to hold one of the wooden practice swords I instruct them to make. I do my best to teach them some of the basics, but I am unsure if they even managed to understand those.
Why did I even bother?

The peasant children are eager to be taught a lesson by my and are caught completely by surprise when I disarm them one by one and give them a thrashing. A couple of them attempt to fight back, but I disarm them again, and soon they are all running away, bruised, crying, and taught not to mess with their betters!
That concludes today's lesson!

As I am passing through yet another village on my journey I notice that there is a local festival of some kind going on. I investigate it and learn that they will be holding an archery contest, and several of the villagers seem eager to compete against a foreigner as they offer to let me compete almost as soon as they spot me.
I'll compete!
I'll not bother with this...

As the first round of the archery competition gets underway it becomes apparent that the villagers have a wide range of skills. Some of them are unable to shoot well enough to be able to hit anything close to their target, while others strike true time and time again. My own skills are good enough that I am not yet disqualified.
Time for the next round

The second round of the archery competition involves shooting at targets further away than those during the first round, and most of the villagers are not skilled enough to manage this. By the time that the round is over it is just me and one other archer that are left, and I expect the final round to be quite challenging.
Time for the true test!

The final round of the archery contest takes a long time to conclude, as I and my opponent seem quite close in skill. Eventually I come out ahead as my opponent misses the centre of her target ever so slightly. She does not seem particularly upset, however, and gives me a quick curtsey, proclaiming that I have bested her fairly.
Well fought!

Though I do my best my skills are not up to the task, and I end up losing the archery competition. The winner, a young woman that apparently has won quite a few contests in the past, is more skilled than nearly every archer I have seen before as far as I can tell, so I suppose it is not too shameful to have lost.
Time for me to leave...

As I keep travelling through foreign lands I sometimes find it difficult to find the kind of food that I would be used to. There is often plenty of foreign cuisine to try, however, and it might perhaps be worth trying it out when I have the opportunity instead of insisting on something familiar.
I'll try some new things!
I think not!
I take the next opportunity to try some new kinds of food and quickly realize that it is quite good. I ask someone to bring me more of it, and by the time the meal is over I have eaten quite a bit.
That was a nice meal!

I try some new kinds of food when the opportunity arises and find that it tastes rather strange. Initially I think that it probably is due to a lack of familiarity with it, but as I force myself to keep eating I start feeling more and more nauseous, and I end up having to fight to keep what I have eaten down.
This was a mistake...

One morning when I am riding through yet another village on my way to where I hope to face off against the [Root.GetTheVeryBestOpponent] a young man with a sword challenges me to a duel upon noticing my sword. Judging by how he is standing, he is not a very good warrior, so it should be trivial to defeat him.
Challenge accepted!
I don't think I'll bother...

As I had predicted my opponent is quite bad, and I easily evade his strikes while testing his defenses. It is a simple enough matter to disarm him once I notice a few flaws in his fighting style, and now that I have beaten my opponent I get to decide what to do with him.
I suppose I can compliment him...
I'll salute him and leave!
I should mock him!
He deserves no mercy!

One day on the road my horse loses one of its shoes, and though it is easy enough for me to get it to the nearest village it turns out the local farrier and his apprentices are sick at the moment, forcing me to remain there for several days.
An unfortunate delay...

Though I am confident that I and the rest of the Warriors of the Rising Sun are the greatest warriors in the world and that our way of warfare is quite good it is still useful to consider how a potential enemy might think, and I feel that I have learned some useful things through discreet inquiries during my journey.
Knowledge is power...

I enter yet another small village on the road towards the location of the [Root.GetTheVeryBestOpponent] and find that the villagers do not seem to be getting along very well at the moment. Inquiring about the situation I learn that two prominent families have dragged nearly everyone into an ongoing feud of theirs. The villagers suggest that I could help settle the dispute.
I can certainly try!
I don't want any part of this...

I meet with representatives from the first family shortly after agreeing to serve as an impartial judge, and they tell me about a number of terrible things that the other family has done. Some things sound rather outlandish, and at times the story is a bit jumbled, making it hard to say what actually might have happened.
I see...
I suspect I am being lied to...

The second family's account of what happened does not match what the first family told me at all. The only real similarities between the two stories is that neither of them seem wholly coherent and that both of them definitely claim that their side is in the right and that the other side is lying.
I see...
I suspect I am being lied to...

Knowing that I have heard what both sides have to say the villagers are eager to hear my verdict. So far it is not entirely clear to me whether either family's story is the truth, though perhaps it is possible to reach a decision even so.
I need more time...
The first family is lying!
The second family is lying!
Both of them are lying!

Though I caught both sides lying to me it still seems prudent to call out the first family alone as I feel that their lies were a bit more substantial. The second family is quick to thank me, and as I would rather not stay around to see what might happen I decide that it is time to leave the village.
I did the right thing...

With the second family's story being a rather obvious lie I decide to rule against them. The first family and their supporters are quite pleased, and though I feel that it would be prudent to leave the village quickly I am still confident that I have made a fairly good judgment.
It was the right decision!

The crowd that is listening to my verdict immediately erups in shouts when I reveal that both families lied to me, and it is not long before the first punch is thrown. Before long the whole village is in chaos, and I decide to leave before someone tries to attack me.
They deserve each other!

I meet with representatives from the first family again to discuss some things that I thought were unclear about their story. To my surprise they admit that perhaps they might have been a bit untruthful and suggest that perhaps some coin would make me ignore this fact and would make me rule against the other family...
I accept your payment!
I will not be bribed!
I will reveal this dishonesty at once!

I gather the villagers and declare that I have a verdict to make. The family I just spoke to seems happy at first, but as I publicly reveal that they just attempted to bribe me and that that makes it clear that they are not in the right their grins fade. I decide to leave the village right away to avoid potential retribution.
It was the right decision!

After being offered a bribe by the first family I am not terribly surprised when the second family also offers a bribe to side with them when I start questioning them about some flaws in their story. It would certainly not be honorable to accept a bribe, but perhaps nobody would find out...
I accept your payment!
I will not be bribed!
I will reveal this dishonesty at once!

I gather the villagers after speaking to the second family and declare that I have reached a conclusion due to the fact that bribery was attempted. I can see that both sides look a bit worried, but when I call out the side O just spoke to the other side's mood brightens, and they cheer for me as I take my leave.
It was the right decision!

With both sides having told me stories that do not make sense and having attempted to bribe me it is clear that I will not learn the actual truth, and it is time to make my verdict as the villagers are starting to become impatient and I also need to be on my way soon.
Side against the first family
Side against the second family
Expose both as being dishonorable

As the bribe the first family offered was larger than the bribe offered by the second family I decide that they are the least honorable family, and I quickly rule against them. Though there are those that would say that I should have ruled against both sides I feel that potentially ending the feud was more important.
It was the right decision!

The first family is quite displeased to learn that I will not rule in their favor despite the fact that I accepted their bribe, and some of them call me out on this. The second family seems a bit surprised by what just happened as I did not accept their bribe, but they are certainly happy.
Money can't buy justice!

Having accepted a bribe from the second family I declare them to be in the right. The first family is definitely not happy, and I would have earned more money if I had sided with them, but it would perhaps have been more dishonorable to have done so or to have gone back on my agreement with the second family.
It was somewhat honorable...

Both families are confident that I will rule in their favor when I gather the villagers together once more, seeing as they know that their side has bribed me. The first family's smiles disappear quickly when I declare that they are in the wrong, and some of them go as far as to call me a deal-breaker.
Someone had to lose...

Though both sides attempted to bribe me and could have been ruled against based on that alone Iu feel that there were more holes in the story the second family told me, and I rule against them based on that. The first family cheers me on as I depart the village, clearly satisfied with my judgment.
It was the right decision!

As I accepted a bribe from the second family they seem confident that I will declare them in the right, but I quickly make them lose their smiles as I rule against them. The first family seems surprised about what just happened, seeing as I did not accept their bribe, but they are definitely happy.
Money can't buy justice!

Since I accepted a bribe from the first family and turned down the bribe of the second family I feel that I am bound to rule in favor of the first family. It is perhaps not as impartial a judgment as people would have expected, but I did make a deal, and it would be dishonorable to alter it....
It was somewhat honorable...

I accepted a bribe from both families, but with the first family paying me more I feel that it is right to take their side. The second family is most unhappy with this development, and several of them accuse me of being a deal-breaker as I prepare to leave the village, which is unsurprising.
Someone had to lose...

Both of the families seeking a verdict from me told inconsistent stories, and both of them attempted to bribe me. The honorable course of action is abundantly clear, and I tell the assembled villagers that both sides are in the wrong. They do not take it well, and start fighting each other even before I can take my leave.
You deserve each other!

Having accepted a bribe it would perhaps be reasonable to honor my agreement with the familiy in question, but I decide that it is more honorable to expose both families as being dishonest. The villagers quickly start shouting at each other, and it is not long before someone throws the first punch.
I should get going...

Both families have paid me to rule against the other, and both clearly expect to be declared in the right. However, I decide that the most honorable cours of action would be to honor both agreements, and thus I rule against both families. A brawl breaks out as I am leaving the village to continue on my journey.
Both got what they paid for!

One day on the road I come across a man dressed in clothes that probably were the height of fashion once but that now look rather worse for wear. He claims to be a local noble down on his luck, and when he learns of my title he is quite impressed and asks whether I would consider buying a family heirloom of his since he in in dire need of money.
I will buy your heirloom!
Keep your paltry trinket!

The man accepts my payment and hands over the heirloom quickly, even if I definitely sense some reluctance. He wishes me luck on my journey and takes his leave, and I wonder whether he will consider the trade worth it down the line or if he will come to regret selling me his heirloom.
I'm sure he'll be fine!

Though it is doubtful that I would have been asked to prove myself the most skilled warrior in the world if the Warriors of the Rising Sun did not believe in me there might be approaches to fighting that I have never seen before. A skilled foreign warrior offers to teach me a few tricks one day on the road, if I am willing to pay him for his time.
This sounds useful!
I don't think so!

One day on the road the weather takes a turn for the worse, and I soon find myself riding through heavy rain. I reach a village after a short while, and could definitely seek shelter there, but if I stay I might end up delayed noticeably as the roads could get worse, which I might be able to avoid if I keep going.
I must press on!
It is better to wait a while...

I leave the village behind and press on despite the rain. It is not the most pleasant journey I have had, and the roads keep getting worse as I continue, but eventually the weather clears and the roads start improving again. Given the state of the roads behind me it was probably good that I kept going.
I made the right decision!

I press on, leaving the village behind me. The downpour gets worse and worse, and my horse struggles to keep its footing from time to time. Though I eventually leave the worst of the downpour behind the roads improve a while after that, I am not sure that it was a good idea to keep going.
I feel unwell...

The route I am taking to the location of the [Root.GetTheVeryBestOpponent] requires passing through a mountain range, and as I am making my way through the mountain pass I had planned to use I find that the way ahead has been blocked due to a rock slide. It would perhaps be possible to climb over the rocks, but circling back might be safer.
I will press on!
It would be best to circle back...

I dismount and start making my way past the rocks, leading my horse behind me. Though the path is somewhat treacherous I am able to make my way to the other side of the fallen rocks without too much trouble, and the way ahead appears to be free of obstacles as far as I can see.
That wasn't so bad...

I dismount and start making my way past the rocks, leading my horse behind me. The path I take is rather treacherous, with the rocks shifting beneath my feet as I move, and though I eventually make it to the other side I have injured myself a bit due to tripping a few times and failing to catch myself in time.
Ow!

One day on the road I come across a strange party of travellers, nine in total. Stopping briefly to converse with their leader I learn that they too are on a quest, seeking to bring about the end of some "dark lord". To my knowledge there is no such person, but perhaps they know something I do not.
Good luck!
Beware the Black Riders!

One night when I am sleeping at an inn in a small village along the road to the location of the [Root.GetTheVeryBestOpponent] I am awakened by the sound of someone moving nearby. Looking out through a crack between the shutters at the window I can see several shadowy figures moving around, likely not planning to conduct any honorable business.
Who goes there?
I must hide from them!

Being on the road without servants and with only a few different outfits has not always made it possible for me to wear the kind of attire that I would consider right and proper back in [Root.Capital.GetName], and at times I wonder whether it actually is worth bothering to make the attempt to look presentable as I keep getting dirty fairly quickly.
Being clean is important!
I should care less...

As I am having an evening meal in the inn of a small and unremarkable village I overhear several of the villagers discussing the subject of poetry. Apparently one of them fancies himself a poet, and the others seem appreciative of his poetry. Perhaps I should take the opportunity to share some poetry of my own poetry?
I will share a poem!
I have no interest in this...

The villagers are a bit surprised to learn that I am a poet, but they are willing to listen to me recite one of my poems. Once I am finished they express their appreciation of my work, and the villager with poetic aspirations states that it is clear that he could improve, though he does not seem particularly upset.
I knew they'd like that!

The villagers are a bit surprised to learn that I am a poet, but they are willing to listen to me recite one of my poems. By the time I am finished it is clear that they regret this decision, and several of them even go as far as suggesting that I should learn from their local poet.
They clearly know nothing of poetry!

Though my quest to seek out the [Root.GetTheVeryBestOpponent] currently is taking up all of my time I have other aspirations as well that I sometimes have not pursued as diligently as I could have. I really should make more of an effort to do so in the future.
Glory will be mine!

The quest to find the [Root.GetTheVeryBestOpponent] is taking up all of my time at the moment, and this has forced me to postpone several other plans I have. At first, I was not finding this to my liking, but the journey has made me reconsider whether those goals actually are worth pursuing.
I should be content with what I have...

The journey to the location of the [Root.GetTheVeryBestOpponent] is taking longer than I initially had expected it to take, and though it at times have been interesting it is starting to become rather tedious. If I do not reach my destination soon, chances are I will need to vent my frustration in some other way than an honorable duel.
Am I there yet?

Being on the road means I no longer have to deal with various matters I would have had to deal with if back home in [Root.Capital.GetName], and I find myself rather enjoying not having to work quite as hard. Perhaps I should take some time away from my work more often...
I should take it easy...

As I am travelling by myself I have been forced to interact with all manner of people I normally would not have to interact with in [Root.Capital.GetName], and though I occasionally have been unable to communicate well due to language differences I have gotten better at knowing what to say.
I'm sure this will be useful!

One day when I am passing through a village on my way to face the [Root.GetTheVeryBestOpponent] I notice that they are holding a local festival of some kind. I take a look around to see just what that entails in this part of the world, and what I find is certainly different from anything I would encounter at a festival back home.
They truly are uncultured!
That was quite interesting!

I have seen many wondrous sights on my journey to the location of the [Root.GetTheVeryBestOpponent], but even so I am taken by surprise the day that I see a celestial dragon moving across the sky, its serpentine body gleaming in the sun. Few can claim to have seen such a majestic creature in person.
Auspicious!

I have heard tales of strange beasts found in foreign lands in the past, but I have usually paid little attention to them as they have sounded rather fanciful. However, when I one day see a large winged creature fly past overhead I am forced to concede that perhaps the tales of fire-breathing dragons are true after all.
I need to watch the skies...

One day on the road nine figures completely shrouded in black come riding in the opposite direction. They all carry swords at their sides, and something about them puts ne at unease. One of them asks me if I have seen the party of someone named "Shiri", or perhaps "Bagin", who is in possession of something precious their lord lost long ago that he wants back.
I can't help you!
I might have seen them earlier...
Perhaps you should check in Zeeland?

I have met my fair share of odd people on the road, but one day I encounter a man that is stranger than most, who claims to be a prophet. Speaking in a rather melodramatic fashion, he declares that I need to ready myself to face the onslaught of the "Burning Empire", which apparently is coming to conquer all I hold dear.
What an odd man...
He speaks the truth!
I am well aware!
We have already defeated them...

Being on the road on a quest for the Warriors of the Rising Sun has made me consider the virtues of the Shinto religion quite a bit, and I have started to wonder if the time perhaps has come to convert to it as I feel that some of its teachings are rather appealing.
I will convert!
I will convert... secretly!
I think not!

Being on the road on a quest for the Warriors of the Rising Sun has made me consider the virtues of the Buddhist religion quite a bit, and I have started to wonder if the time perhaps has come to convert to it as I feel that some of its teachings are rather appealing.
I will convert!
I will convert... secretly!
I think not!

The Warrios of the Rising Sun are closely tied to Japan, and though foreign warriors sometimes join the society and sometimes rise quite far it is harder to gain the respect of the other members if you are not Japanese, which I am quite aware of. Perhaps the time has come for me to fully embrace Japanese culture...
I should become Japanese!
I think not!

There have been times during my voyage to face the [Root.GetTheVeryBestOpponent] when I have felt uncertain as to whether embarking on my quest was a good idea, but I am starting to feel more and more certain that I made the right decision and that [Root.TrueReligion.GetHighGodName] looks favorably on my quest.
[Root.TrueReligion.GetHighGodName] is with me!

Though things at times have gone well for me I have sometimes felt as if my life lacked purpose, and at times the world has seemed to be against me. However, the journey to face the [Root.GetTheVeryBestOpponent] has given me purpose, and I am starting to feel that things perhaps are changing for the better.
Life isn't so bad...

One day when I am having a meal at an inn a foreign woman takes a seat on the opposite side of my table. Introducing herself as a Hermetic scholar somewhat down on her luck, she offers to share some of her supposedly vast knowledge with me in exchange for a rather modest amount of gold.
Tell me what you know!
I don't think so!

As I am travelling in foreign lands I have often found myself needing to ask for directions or needing to purchase maps of the areas I have been passing through, and though I doubt that the locals have been trying to mislead me there have been times when I have ended up taking the wrong path due to confusing instructions, such as today.
A temporary setback...

As I am travelling in foreign lands I have often found myself needing to ask for directions or needing to purchase maps of the areas I have been passing through, and though I doubt that the locals have been going out of their way to help me they have sometimes let me know about useful shortcuts, such as today.
This is going well!

As I am passing through a thick forest I spot a group of people dressed in strange clothes standing together and chanting in some unknown language. They do not appear to have spotted me, but whatever they are doing is filling me with unease, and I might perhaps want to intervene before they accomplish whatever they are trying to accomplish.
They must be stopped!
This does not concern me...

I attack the figures in the forest, cutting several of them down before they even realize I am there. Their attempt to resist is quite feeble, and I easily kill all of those that do not run. When I mention what happened when stopping in a nearby village the villagers are upset, as I apparently interrupted an ordinary religious ceremony.
How could I have known?

I attack the figures in the forest, cutting several of them down before they even realize I am there. Their attempt to resist is quite feeble, and I easily kill all of those that do not run. When I mention what happened when stopping in a nearby village the villagers are happy to hear that I stopped the ritual of a secretive local cult.
I only did what was right!

I attack the figures in the forest, cutting several of them down before they even realize I am there. I take a few minor wounds when they fight back, but I eventually manage to kill all of those that do not run. When I mention what happened to some local villagers they are upset, as I apparently interrupted a perfectly normal religious ceremony.
How could I have known?

I attack the figures in the forest, cutting several of them down before they even realize I am there. I take a few minor wounds when they fight back, but I eventually manage to kill all of those that do not run. When I mention what happened to some local villagers they are quite happy to hear that I stopped a secretive local cult.
I only did what was right!

I attack the figures in the forest, cutting several of them down before they even realize I am there. I take a rather grievous wound in the fighting, but in the end I am triumphant. When I mention what happened to some local villagers they are upset, as I apparently interrupted a perfectly normal religious ceremony.
How could I have known?

I attack the figures in the forest, cutting several of them down before they even realize I am there. I take a rather grievous wound in the fighting, but in the end I amtriumphant. When I mention what happened to some local villagers they are quite happy to hear that I stopped what apparently was the ritual of a secretive local cult.
I only did what was right!

I attack the figures in the forest, cutting several of them down before they even realize I am there. However, they recover from their shock more quickly than I had anticipated, and I soon find myself surrounded. Though I fight to the best of my ability I am eventually overcome, and I fall to the ground, my vision fading...
This cannot be!

One day I notice a rather curious sight next the road I am travelling on. A fairly large bounder is standing all by itself, and a sword appears to somehow have been jammed into it, with little but the hilt visible. Looking more closely at it, I cannot really see how the sword ever ended up there.
I wonder if I can pull it free...
I should keep going...

I reach out and grab the hilt of the sword easily enough, attempting to pull it free with all of my strength. It does not appear to move at all, and despite making several more attempts I am unable to pull the sword free.
How odd...

I reach out and grab the hilt of the sword easily enough, and I only need to make a token effort to pull it free. The blade is quite old, and I notice that the edge most definitely has become dull. It would not be useful as a weapon, and it is certainly not interesting enough to take with me.
I should put this back...

I have come across a number of abandoned ruins and strange structures during my journey, and in the past I have not paid much attention to them. However, today I came across a rather larger stone circle, and I started to wonder if it perhaps would be worth investigating it more closely.
I will investigate it!
It would be a waste of time...

The stone circle is clearly something of human origin, and it has clearly not been used for quite some time as it is mostly overgrown. Taking a look around, I do not spot anything obvious that would let me guess as to its original purpose, and even when I decide to remove some of the moss I can find nothing of interest.
That was a waste of time...

The stone circle is clearly something of human origin, and it has clearly not been used for quite some time as it is mostly overgrown. Taking a look around, I do not spot anything obvious that would let me guess as to its original purpose. When I remove some of the moss from one of the stones I manage find a depiction of two warriors engaged in a duel.
Interesing...

One day I enter a village and overhear a herald proclaiming that there is a reward to be gained by the man or woman who can bring the head of a local bandit chief to the captain of the guard. Inquiring further, I learn that this bandit chief and his band of bandits has been causing the region a lot of trouble recently.
I will hunt him down!
I have better things to do...

I spend several days searching for the bandits that supposedly are hidden near the village, but I do not manage to find any sign of them. Perhaps they have moved on to another area, seeing as they are being actively hunted, or perhaps they are exceptionally good at hiding. Whatever the truth is, I cannot afford to keep looking.
I did my best...

By pure chance I stumble upon the bandits' trail easily enough, and I have no trouble at all following the trail to their encampment. As best I can tell, they are making preparations to depart, so if I do not choose to fight them it is very likely that they will slip away before anyone else can find them.
I will attack them right away!
This is someone else's problem...

Confident in their ability to hide the bandits have not even posted sentries, and I am among them before they notice my presence. Several of them fall before they can pull their weapons free, and not even their chief puts up much a fight. It is a simple enough matter to behead the man and disperse his followers.
That was easy!

The bandits have not seen fit to post sentries, but even so some of them spot me before I can get close to them, and they ready their weapons to fight me. The fighting is fierce, and I take a number of wounds during the battle, but eventually I manage to disperse them after beheading their leader.
They fought well!

The bandits' sentries spot me as I make my approach, and I quickly find myself having to fight to move any further. I take a number of wounds in the fighting, and the fight initially does not seem to go my way. Eventually, I manage to kill the bandit chief, and the rest of them slip away. Pursuing them would be foolish.
That was far too close...

I move towards the centre of the bandits' encampment, readying my weapon. Though it appears as if I have not been noticed at first I discover that I am mistaken when a volley of arrows suddenly comes at me. Several of them hit their mark, and the bandits waste no time closing in for the kill.
This cannot be!

One day I notice that someone has carved something into the wall of a cliff just to the side of the road. Investigating the carvings I realize that it is a depiction of a number of strangely dressed warriors fighting duels with one another, and though some liberties clearly have been taken there are at least a couple of useful things depicted.
Interesting...

Being on the road with only a handful of possessions on me has made me consider whether I actually need everything I have back home even when I am there. Though there are things that I own that definitely are useful, I have perhaps been a bit too greedy in the past.
I don't need money to be happy!

There are times when I feel that there has been far too many things that I have been expected to do as both a ruler and a warrior, and though some of them might have been rather important it has been exhausting to have to deal with all of those things. Now that I have been on the road for a while I have finally been able to relax.
This journey was good for me!
At the Edge of the Dunes

It has been a long journey, but I have finally arrived at the supposed location of the Sword of the Shifting Sands. Situated at the very edge of the Sahara Desert, the merchant city I have arrived at is larger than I had expected, and the people seem friendly enough despite the fact that I am an outsider.\n\nAsking the guards at the gate about the Sword of the Shifting Sands, I learn that the locals believe that the Sword can be found in one of the nearby oases, and that there likely are people in the city that would be able to guide me.
I should check in the bazaar!

I start asking the merchants in the bazaar whether they know how to get to the oasis of the Sword of the Shifting Sands. The first dozen or so claim that they have no idea, but eventually I find a cartographer who has a map of the area and who would be willing to mark the oasis for me, though the price he sets for the map is rather steep.
I'll buy your map!
I'll get back to you...

A couple of days after speaking to the cartographer I am approached by a young boy dressed in clothes similar to those worn by various desert tribesmen I have seen. He says that he knows that I seek the Sword of the Shifting Sands due to overhearing some gossip about me, and offers to guide me for a small sum of gold.
You're hired!
I'll get back to you...

As I continue asking around in the city I learn of an old man that supposedly has guided caravans through the desert for nearly sixty years. It is easy enough for me to find him in a house nearby, and when I ask about the oasis of the Sword of the Shifting Sands he offers his services as a guide in exchange for a modest amount of gold.

I think my statement was good...

I think I got it right...

"Welcome!" a voice calls out from one of the upper levels, where I can see a man standing on a balcony. "You must be here to fight me!" He laughs a bit before continuing. "You will have to pass through the challenges inside to reach me!"

With that, he disappears inside, letting out yet another laugh.
Let's see what is inside...

However, as I reach the base of a large stairway IU notice that what I initially thought was a bunch of vines covering the stairs instead is a number of hooded snakes, which doubtless are not going to be friendly.
I can get past them!
I can't risk this...
